content:
_gencontinuous (which simply does _gencontinuous -watch) is always re-building

Processing changes to 22 files @ Thu, Jan 2, 2020 19:30+0100

oh an then it eventually crashes

Jekyll: Generating...
Jekyll: [31m                    ------------------------------------------------[0m
Jekyll: [31m      Jekyll 4.0.0   Please append `--trace` to the `build` command [0m
Jekyll: [31m                     for any additional information or backtrace. [0m
Jekyll: [31m                    ------------------------------------------------[0m
Jekyll has failed. Complete output from running Jekyll: [31m                    ------------------------------------------------[0m

Note: Check that Jekyll is installed correctly
Publishing Content Failed: Process exited with an error: 1 (Exit value: 1)

Use -? to get command line help

Stack Dump (for debugging):
org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteException: Process exited with an error: 1 (Exit value: 1)
        at org.apache.commons.exec.DefaultExecutor.executeInternal(DefaultExecutor.java:404)
        at org.apache.commons.exec.DefaultExecutor.execute(DefaultExecutor.java:166)
        at org.apache.commons.exec.DefaultExecutor.execute(DefaultExecutor.java:153)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.runJekyll(Publisher.java:4695)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.runTool(Publisher.java:4615)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.generate(Publisher.java:4127)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.execute(Publisher.java:679)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.main(Publisher.java:6705)
I think i missed that memo. I have been using other methods, just thought of looking at this one. not urgent, but thought of reporting it
